title: Shane Lowry Sets British Open Scoring Record, Widens Lead
summary: The Irishman leads Tommy Fleetwood by four strokes; Sunday tee times moved up due to weather. PORTRUSH, Northern Ireland-Just one year ago, Shane Lowry might have been the most miserable player at the British Open. His first round at Carnoustie went so poorly that he fired his longtime caddie on the spot. His second round sent him trudging home to Ireland after missing the cut, one more downward turn in a seemingly spiraling career.

title: Iran's Tanker Seizure Presents U.K. With Policy Dilemma
summary: London and Tehran trade accusations as Britain grows further enmeshed in crisis pitting Iran against the U.S.. Britain's decision to seize an Iranian tanker off the coast of its overseas territory of Gibraltar earlier this month is fast snowballing, dragging the country deeper into an escalating crisis between Iran and the West.

title: Drug Makers, Distributors Failed to Stop Suspect Opioid Shipments, Filing Alleges
summary: Motion filed in federal court in Cleveland alleges companies 'turned a blind eye' to massive evidence of abuse. Many of the nation's largest drug manufacturers and distributors failed to implement even the most basic systems to halt suspicious drug orders as the opioid epidemic came into sharp focus, plaintiffs lawyers allege in a new court filing.

title: USS Boxer Crew Describes Tense Moments in Strait of Hormuz
summary: Close encounters with Iranian ships; many crew members didn't realize they had downed a drone. ABOARD THE USS BOXER-The Marines, armed with machine guns, started taking their places in the early dawn light of Thursday morning, standing guard where intruders might board the USS Boxer as it began entering the Strait of Hormuz.

title: Why Weak Corporate Earnings Don't Signal a Weak Economy
summary: Tepid results from multinationals don't necessarily signal trouble at home. American companies are reporting second-quarter results, and the numbers so far have been nothing to write home about. Based on current estimates compiled by FactSet, earnings for companies in the S&P 500 will be down 1.9% from a year earlier. Actual results probably will be somewhat better given companies' tendency to lower the bar and then clear it, but the final figures are unlikely to fit anyone's definition of good.

title: My Compliments to the Chef, Er, Robot
summary: Automated machines take over New York kitchens. Robots are making their way into New York City's restaurants.

title: Dangerous Heat Wave Covers Much of U.S.
summary: Highest heat-index readings are expected in Kansas City and a stretch from Philadelphia to Raleigh. About 128 million people are under excessive-heat warnings from parts of Kansas and Nebraska to the East Coast, the National Weather Service said.

title: What Do You Do When the Golf Course Shuts Down?
summary: Neighbors who bought homes for 'quiet and serenity' face off with developers who want to build hundreds of homes in one South Carolina community. BLYTHEWOOD, S.C.-Weeds engulf the fairways. Branches break through the clubhouse windows. And buyers pass on the chance to own a home near the sixth hole.

title: 'N.C. Wyeth: New Perspectives' Review: Between Power and Platitude
summary: An exhibition at the Brandywine River Museum of Art attests to the artist's long struggle to free himself from his reputation as an illustrator..

title: Netanyahu Becomes Israel's Longest-Serving Premier Amid Political Storm
summary: Leader achieves record as his tenure is threatened by tough election and corruption allegations. TEL AVIV-Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu becomes the country's longest-serving premier on Saturday with his legacy under scrutiny and his political future on the line ahead of a tough election.

title: Hollywood Writers Struggle to Get on Same Page in Fight Against Agents
summary: Some writers secretly return to their representatives as battle with talent agencies lingers. In April, the Writers Guild of America declared war on the big Hollywood talent agencies about longstanding business practices they say are unfair and rife with conflicts of interest. In a show of solidarity, more than 7,000 movie and TV writers subsequently fired their agents, according to the guild.

title: Candidate Sleepovers Mean Tight Quarters, Wet Towels and 'Surreal' Family-Room Chats
summary: Booker, handful of other presidential hopefuls pass up hotels in favor of guest bedrooms and pull-out couches.. BRENTWOOD, N. H.-Sen. Cory Booker sat on the family-room floor with New Hampshire State Sen. Jon Morgan and his wife Katie, a physician assistant, until past midnight last Saturday.

title: Even Passive Giants Aren't Immune From Investors' Changing Tastes
summary: State Street and BlackRock reported lower earnings in second quarter. The surging popularity of low-cost investment funds has dialed up the pressure on most asset managers-including some of the firms most responsible for the industry's transformation.

title: A Bike Race From the Back of a Motorcycle
summary: Our reporter follows La Course, the one-day women's event hosted by the Tour de France, from a unique perspective. PAU, France-The motorcycle radio crackled for what seemed like the millionth time Friday morning. In more than three hours of riding on the back of it, in the slipstream of a bicycle race, I'd made out maybe half the messages. But this one came through loud and clear.

summary: Blackout affects about 6.6 million viewers of DirecTV, DirecTV Now and U-verse.

title: The Mysteries of Kate Atkinson
summary: The novelist's sharp, sly, sad books-including her new crime novel 'Big Sky'-transcend their genres. Kate Atkinson has a practice of making herself scarce whenever her latest book is about to be published. "Big Sky," the fifth of her novels to feature the gruff, melancholy private eye Jackson Brodie, was released at the end of June, which is precisely when Ms. Atkinson drove three hours from her home in Edinburgh to a deer park in Yorkshire.

title: Yes, You Actually Should Be Using Emojis at Work
summary: Once viewed as a frivolity, emojis are now key to clear and concise communication, esprit de corps and cultivating a shared corporate culture. At first, Marek Nowak, a 32-year-old engineer at enterprise cloud software company CircleCI, was skeptical of using emojis when communicating with colleagues. Now, whenever he posts the minutes of his team meetings in Slack, he precedes them with a custom emoji of a teddy bear giving a hug.

title: On This Day of the Moon Mission: 'One Small Step'
Gene Scalia's Winning Record
summary: Trump's Labor pick has the legal experience to navigate the bureaucracy.. President Trump tweeted Thursday that he plans to nominate Eugene Scalia to replace Alex Acosta as Labor Secretary. The son of the late Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia is an excellent choice and with Deputy Secretary Pat Pizzella should continue the Administration's reform agenda.

title: A Quick Guide to Emojis in the Office
summary: Smiley face, ok. Kissy face, not so much. And please don't use the poop.. Emojis have become an integral part of digital communication, but are they appropriate for office interactions?

title: Kyoto Fire Suspect Was Once Jailed for Armed Robbery
summary: Man suspected of starting fatal fire at animation studio was given three-and-a-half-year jail sentence in 2012. SAITAMA, Japan-A man suspected of starting a fire that killed 34 people at a Kyoto animation studio was once jailed for armed robbery and earlier this week threatened a neighbor with violence, according to the neighbor.

title: Iran Seizes British-Flagged Oil Tanker
summary: Mounting tensions between Tehran and the West risk further disruption of commercial shipping in the strategically vital waterway.. TEHRAN, Iran-Iranian forces seized a British-flagged oil tanker in the Strait of Hormuz, as mounting tensions between Tehran and the West risked further disruption of commercial shipping in the strategically vital waterway.
